frame.name: Expensiveness
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Payer</fen> gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an <fen>Asset</fen> (generally money) in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>. This event is often more specifically described as gaining possession of some <fen>Goods</fen> or receiving a Service. In the majority of cases, the <fen>Payer</fen> is described generically (INI), and the situation depicted answers the question of how much of an <fen>Asset</fen> would have to be given up to receive the <fen>Goods</fen> or bring about the <fen>Intended_event</fen>.
<ex>It 'll <t>cost</t> <fex name="Payer">Sandra's parents</fex> <fex name="Asset">fifty grand a year</fex> <fex name="Intended_event">for her to attend that school</fex>. </ex> <ex><fex name="Intended_event">That book</fex> would <t>cost</t> <fex name="Payer">you</fex> <fex name="Asset">more than twenty dollars</fex> <fex name="Intended_event">to bind</fex> <fex name="">in a local book bindery</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Goods">Stamps</fex> used to <t>cost</t> <fex name="Asset">only five cents</fex>. <fex name="Payer">INI</fex></ex> <ex>The <t>cost</t> <fex name="Intended_event">of a trip to a resort or spa</fex> varies by region, dependent primarily on weather, not local economic conditions. <fex name="Payer">INI</fex></ex> <ex>Well, <fex name="Intended_event">it</fex> 'll <t>cost</t> <fex name="Payer">you</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Payer">For you</fex>, <fex name="Asset">thirty bucks</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Degree">practically</fex> <t>free</t>. <fex name="Intended_event">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed. <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument: <ex><fex name="Goods">These paintings</fex> are very <t>pricey</t>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Payer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>. This FE is often expressed as INI. <ex>A holiday in Europe is very <t>expensive</t> <fex name="Payer">for me</fex>.</ex> <ex>Europe is not <t>cheap</t>. <fex name="Payer">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Asset
FE.definition: <def-root>The price of or payment made for the Goods. <ex>The painting was <t>cheap</t> <fex name="Asset">at $600</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Asset">$600</fex> is <t>exorbitant</t> for that painting!</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Origin
FE.definition: <def-root>The place where a transaction would take place, generally where <fen>Goods</fen> and services are created or sold. <ex>Shirts are <t>cheap</t> <fex name="Origin">at K-Mart</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which <fen>Goods</fen> are cheap or expensive.</def-root >

FE.name: Intended_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Intended_event">Attending summer school</fex> is <t>expensive</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time when a transaction takes place.
<ex>No, they've got a special on; it's really <t>cheap</t> there <fex name="Time">on Tuesdays</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of an <fen>Asset</fen> relative to some measure of the <fen>Goods</fen></def-root>
